intro: Ipomoea nyctaginea var. cordifolia, commonly known as the heartleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of violet or blue. The plant belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is known for its vigorous climbing habit. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers that open in the morning and close at dusk. The seeds are enclosed in a fleshy, red or orange capsule that splits open when mature.
